  • Reference

Calculates a given function on the dataset for each studyDay and grouped by the column 'userId'. Needs a function, which has a dataframe as input and a singular value as output. A summary function, which summarizes the results for each day, will be evaluated for each 'userId'.

Source: R/calcFeaturePerStudyDayAndUserId.R
calcFeaturePerStudyDayAndUserId.Rd

Calculates a given function on the dataset for each studyDay and grouped by the column 'userId'. Needs a function, which has a dataframe as input and a singular value as output. A summary function, which summarizes the results for each day, will be evaluated for each 'userId'.

calcFeaturePerStudyDayAndUserId(data, fun, colname, summary_fun, max_study_day,
  impute_empty_day = NA, export_results_per_day = FALSE)

Arguments

data

dataframe. Dataframe containing column named 'userId', which should be the unique identifier for each ID.
fun

function. Must be a function, which has a dataframe as input and a vector (of length nrow(dataframe)) as output.
colname

character. Column name of the new column.
summary_fun

function. Must be a function, which has a vector as input and a singular value as output.
max_study_day

integer. Function will be evaluated until the max study day.
impute_empty_day

can be character, factor, or numerical. Results on days, which did not have any data, will be imputed with this value.
export_results_per_day

logical. If TRUE, an additional dataframe, where fun is evaluated at each studyDay, is returned.

Value

dataframe with columns userId and colname. One value for each userId.

See also

Other feature functions: calcFeaturePerUserId

Examples

fun = function(data) {
  nrow(dplyr::filter(data, RUNNING_TASKS_baseActivity_mPackage == "com.android.chrome"))
} #number uses google chrome
summary_fun = function(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
data = addStudyDay(studentlife.small)
#> If you have data with different users, be aware, that this function ignores that! See addStudyDayPerUserId().
calcFeaturePerStudyDayAndUserId(data = data, fun = fun, colname = "mean_uses_chrome_per_day",
 summary_fun = summary_fun)
#> max_study_day will be automatically calculated from the given data.
#>   userId mean_uses_chrome_per_day
#> 1      1                 33.16667
#> 2      2                  1.50000
#> 3      3                 33.00000
